title: Firefox automatically switches to a tab once it loads
content:
Hello,

So I have this habbit I love which is opening a link on a new tab, then continue browsing the content on my old tab until the new one loads, or when I am done reading through it. Recently, firefox has been switching automatically to the new tab once it loads, which interrupts my workflow/reading a lot.

Is there a way I can stop this or turn this feature off? I believe I start experiencing this after an update.

title: remote debugging server
content:
hello thank you all , i need your help to solve my probleme. i need to setup firefox remot debugging server on a localhost. but re remote debugging server of firefox is not working/establishing a connection, when i test local port 6000 after performing this command 

"D:\Path\To\firefox.exe" -start-debugger-server 6000 -no-remote -safe-mode

or "D:\Path\To\firefox.exe" -start-debugger-server "configured port on about:confi i tested several ports like 9222,6000,7000,6080 and configured devtools.debugger.remote to True in about:config page of browser and dissabled the firewall and antimaleware of windows 10 , but still does not work. even i reinstalled the last version of desktop firefox from your website but still the remote debugging server does not stablish a connection o any port. i sure the problem is not from my system. can u help me , what should i do to stablish a local remote debugging server using desktop version of firefox? help me. i am really in problem . i have done that job using microsoft edge but i need to use firefox.

I am using the latest Windows which is still not bloatware/ spyware - Windows 7. I think, I am not the only one person in the world who is not going to update Windows 7, to later Win versions, until Microsoft will change it's attitude to the client interests. Please, make all newest updates accessible for Win7.

title: Firefox ESR 115.21 Missing CVEs
content:
Hi All We are utilising the Firefox ESR 115.21 (current release) on some devices to keep them as risk free as possible while we work on upgrading them. I was wondering if the CVE that our monitoring software is reporting as currently open vulnerabilities against version 115.21 are correct and if so, is there any plan to mitigate these in the upcoming ESR between now and Aug 2025? I would just like to understand so I can document on our end appropriately. Thanks in advance.

Mozilla Firefox ESR (x64 en-US) (ver. 115.21.0) CVE's: CVE Details - Risk - Date of Release CVE-2024-7518 6.5 Aug 7, 2024 CVE-2024-7520 8.8 Aug 7, 2024 CVE-2024-7528 8.8 Aug 7, 2024 CVE-2024-8385 9.8 Sep 4, 2024 CVE-2024-8386 6.1 Sep 4, 2024 CVE-2024-9397 6.1 Oct 2, 2024 CVE-2024-9398 5.3 Oct 2, 2024

title: I don't want Firefox to import anything from Chrome, not my bookmarks, not my history
content: I have one computer. I use Chrome for work stuff. I use Firefox for personal stuff. I installed the new Firefox as I was supposed to, and it closed all my tabs. I usually have the option to restore my previous session, but not this time. So I started going back through my history (grrrrr....) and my history is full of all the sites/tabs I visited with Chrome. I DO NOT want work stuff mixing with my personal stuff. Besides the fact that it is making it harder for me to restore my lost tabs, there is a reason I have two different browsers. I wish Firebox weren't trying to change my organizational scheme. I DO NOT WANT FIREFOX TO IMPORT HISTORY OR BOOKMARKS FROM CHROME. How do I turn this off?
